channel.title: Python News
channel.description: Python-related news and announcements. Python is an interpreted, interactive, object-oriented programming language.

item.title: EuroPython 2008 Registration is Open
item.description: EuroPython 2008 registration is now open. A generous discount is available for early registrations until 31st May. Visit the registration page for further information!

item.title: Python 2.6alpha3 and 3.0alpha5 released
item.description: The third alpha release of Python 2.6 and the fifth alpha release of Python 3.0 are now available.

item.title: PyCon FR May 17/18 in Paris
item.description: PyCon FR, the French national Python conference, takes place at the Cite des sciences et de la Villette on May 17 and 18

item.title: PyOhio Call for Participation
item.description: PyOhio, a regional Python miniconference, will be held July 26, 2008 in Columbus, OH. Talk proposals are due by June 1.

item.title: Python wins Linux Journal Readers' Choice Award
item.description: Python takes the Favorite Scripting Language award, the magazine announced today.

item.title: SciPy Conference: Caltech, August 19-24
item.description: The SciPy 2008 Conference will be held at Caltech again this year during the week of August 19-24, 2008. More information will be posted as the schedule matures.

item.title: Python Sprint Weekend
item.description: A weekend of Python sprinting around the world is planned for May 10-11 to tackle issues from the Python bug tracker. See the Python wiki for more information, and join us online or at your local user group!

item.title: S3 Call for Participation
item.description: The Workshop on Self-sustaining Systems (S3) 2008 will be held in Potsdam, Germany on May 14-16, 2008. The program and registration information are now available online.

item.title: EuroSciPy Call for Participation
item.description: The EuroSciPy 2008 Conference will be held in Leipzig, Germany on July 26-27, 2008. The Call for Participation is up, and registration is open.

item.title: EuroPython 2008 Call for Participation
item.description: EuroPython 2008 will take place in Vilnius, Lithuania from 7th July until 12th July (including sprints). Proposals for talks and activities are now welcome!

item.title: PSF Community Awards
item.description: The first Python Software Foundation Community Awards were announced at PyCon 2008 and on the PSF Blog. Congratulations to Matthew Dixon Cowles, Brad Knowles, Peter Kropf, and Martin Thomas, and many thanks for their contributions to the Python community!

item.title: Python 2.6alpha2 and 3.0alpha4 released
item.description: The second alpha release of Python 2.6 and the fourth alpha release of Python 3.0 are now available.

item.title: PyCon FR Call for Proposals
item.description: PyCon Fr - Journ√©es Python will take place in Paris, France on May 17-18, 2008. It's not too late for new proposals!

item.title: PyCon Italia Call for Proposals
item.description: PyCon Italia is happening May 9-11, 2008 in Firenze -- see the Call for Papers.

item.title: Python 2.3.7 and 2.4.5
item.description: The final releases of Python 2.3.7 and Python 2.4.5 are now available.

item.title: Call for bids for PyCon 2010
item.description: So you want to host PyCon 2010...

item.title: Python 2.3.7c1 and 2.4.5c1
item.description: The release candidates of Python 2.3.7 and Python 2.4.5 are now available.

item.title: Python 2.6alpha1 and 3.0alpha3 released
item.description: The first alpha release of Python 2.6 and the third alpha release of Python 3.0 are now available.

item.title: Python 2.5.2 (final)
item.description: Python 2.5.2 (final) is now available. This is a bugfix release of Python 2.5.

item.title: Call for Papers: Dynamic Languages Symposium 2008
item.description: DLS 2008 invites high quality papers reporting original research, innovative contributions or experience related to dynamic languages, their implementation and application.

item.title: Python 2.5.2 (release candidate 1)
item.description: Python 2.5.2 (release candidate 1) is now available. This is a bugfix release of Python 2.5.

item.title: Jython Sprint in San Francisco: Saturday, Feb. 16
item.description: The Jython developers are holding a Jython sprint to work on features planned for Jython 2.5. Spaces are still available for interested developers; sign up now!

item.title: Python Bug Day: Saturday, Feb. 23
item.description: The Python developers are holding another Python Bug Day to work on issues in the Python bug tracker. Join us on IRC and contribute!

item.title: PyCon 2008 Financial Aid Available
item.description: The Python Software Foundation has allocated some funds to help people attend PyCon 2008. The financial aid can cover some or all of: registration, hotel, and transportation. The deadline for applications is February 11th. Details & instructions are on the PyCon web site.

item.title: Workshop on Self-sustaining Systems (S3)
item.description: This Workshop is a forum for the discussion of languages that are able to bootstrap, implement, modify and maintain themselves, such as ... PyPy/Python...
